clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Pelvic Tilt and Sit to Stand Task in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Influence Of Pelvic Inclination On Sit To Stand Task In Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess and determine the influence of pelvic inclination on sit to stand task in stroke patients.

detailed_description.textblock: There is a crucial need to have a better understanding of effect of pelvic inclination on sit to stand activity and to know the important factors to be considered to improve the patients' treatment and performance. sixty participants are recruiting to assess the pelvic tilt angles in stroke patients during sitting position and to analyze the influence of pelvic tilt angles on ability to perform sit to stand task during rising from a chair in stroke patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One shot (Each participant is assessed immediately and it takes about 15 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Total pelvic tilt will be calculated as the difference between the anterior pelvic tilt and posterior pelvic tilt angles which measured by the palpation meter (PALM) inclinometer. It will be assessed as one shot in one assessment session.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pelvic Inclination analysis in sit to stand task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One shot (Each participant is assessed immediately and it takes about 10 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: Pelvic Inclination analysis in sit to stand task by Two dimensional video based motion analysis in three phases of sit to stand task. It will be assessed as one shot in one assessment session.

arm_group.description: 30 stroke patients, their age range form 35 to less than 60 are recruiting to assess the pelvic tilt angles from sitting position and from the dynamic task of sit to stand.

30 Normal subjects without any diseases or dysfunctions , their age range form 35 to less than 60 are recruiting to assess the pelvic tilt angles from sitting position and from the dynamic task of sit to stand.

intervention.description: Each group will be passed by three phases of assessment. Firstly assess the pelvic tilt angles from sitting position. Secondly assess the pelvic tilt angles from dynamic sit to stand task. Thirdly, assess the ability to perform sit to stand task of each participant.

study_pop.textblock: The patients are recruiting from the Out-patient clinic for Neuromuscular Disorders and Its Surgery, Faculty of Physical Therapy, Cairo University and Out- patient clinic of El-kasr El-Aini Hospital, Faculty of Medicine, Cairo University

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients' age range from 35-60 years old.
- Normal body weight with a body mass index (BMI) ranges from 18.5 to 24.9 kg/m2.
- Patients' will have the ability to maintain sitting position without using any aids.
- Cooperative patients with ability to understand instructions and follow simple verbal commands.
- The duration of illness will be from six months to 5 years.
- The degree of lower limb spasticity will be ranged between (1:1+) according to the Modified Ashworth Scale.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of previous strokes and other neurological disorders.
- Visual, auditory and vestibular deficits.
- Cognitive impairments and language deficits.
- Leg length discrepancy is more than 0.5 cm.
- Previous history of orthopedic conditions in back or lower limbs (e.g. low back pain, fractures, deformities and surgeries).
